isCurrentLang
The function checks whether the transmitted value of the language scheme corresponds to the current localization value of the user running the algorithm.
Syntax
isCurrentLang
(lang_scheme)
Purpose
Purpose
lang_scheme
Selecting a language scheme to verify compliance with the local language of the System.
The parameter value is set by selecting the object of the "Language scheme" registry [SYS_LANG_SCHEMA] using the
dict
function.
Note
The function is called from the
"Additional"
tab of the algorithm editor toolbar.
When calling the function, the "Language scheme" modal window opens, in which the value for the "lang_scheme" parameter is selected.
The function returns a boolean value:
true
when the current system language of the user running the algorithm corresponds to the one transmitted through the algorithm;
false
when the current system language of the user running the algorithm does not match the one transmitted through the algorithm.
Example
Depending on the language selected on the platform, it is necessary to return the appropriate value for the name of the certificate signature verification attribute.
The language is checked using the isCurrentLang function, which selects the value of the Systemâ€™s language scheme as a parameter.
Other functions were also used to write this algorithm.
The conditions are set by the
if
function.
The
return
function is used to return the value.
The text is output using
text
.
The date is displayed in the specified format using the DateFormat function.
